previous.name: In the Land of the Vajjis

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṃ viharati pāvārikambavane.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Nālandā in Pāvārika’s mango grove.

segments.pli: Atha kho, upāli gahapati, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho, upāli gahapati, bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the householder Upāli went up to the Buddha … and said to him:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti?
segments.en: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life?

segments.pli: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti?
segments.en: What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life?” …
(This should be told in full as in SN 35.124.)

segments.pli: “Ayaṃ kho, gahapati, hetu ayaṃ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Nālandā…

suttaplex.blurb: At Nālandā, the householder Upāli asks the Buddha why some become awakened in this very life, while others do not.
